@ascrutae The `srcSpanType` required based on service list query. Only Entry and Exit service/operation have service topology, and at the same time, Entry topology based on `REF`, but Exit topology, especially based on collector.
Is it means that the service list cannot be found any data If the first span is a local span?

@carlvine500 I suggest you should learn https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/skywalking-agent-testcases/tree/master/rocketMQ-scenario first, and
1. Rename `rocketMQ-scenario` to `apache-rocketMQ-scenario` or `rocketMQ-4.x-scenario`
1. Add `rocketMQ-3.x-scenario`
1. Learn from our 4.x test cases and finish your 3.x test cases.
1. @ascrutae will help you run the cases on our infra, and provide the test results and related logs in GitHub.

CC @ascrutae please provide helps.

@ascrutae Pay attention for the multi threads in **Hystrix**. This component is really important in Spring eco system. But be advised, create span for **Hystrix** is meaningless, but tracing retry by creating new thread and propagate context, also log the exception it triggers. those are really matter.

HTTPClient is a little old. The last version of 3.x released more than ten years ago. http://archive.apache.org/dist/httpcomponents/commons-httpclient/3.0/

I will not suggest the core team to support them. If you or anyone else is interested in supporting this version, we are welcome to guide you and accept your pull request. Thanks.

@evbasso I have already started to work with @lemon about .NET agent for SkyWalking. Here is the link https://github.com/OpenSkywalking/skywalking-csharp . If you are interested, welcome to join me. 

And I am closing this issue, since other language has their own repository.
